English.Char_Desc_45: Fast complex math library for BC++ (DOS)
English.Char_Desc_80: CMATH: Complex math library (cartesian and polar) for Borland C/C++ (DOS)
English.Char_Desc_250: CMATH for Borland C++ (DOS) makes fast complex-number math functions (cartesian and polar) available in three precisions. This comprehensive library was written in Assembler for superior speed and accuracy. All functions may be called from C or C++.
English.Char_Desc_450: CMATH is a comprehensive library for complex-number arithmetics and mathematics, both in cartesian and polar format (float, double, and extended precision). The implementation in Assembler ensures superior speed, accuracy, and safety, as compared to other available complex class libraries with their inline or compiled C++ code. All CMATH functions may be called from C or C++. For Borland C++ 3.0 or higher.
English.Char_Desc_2000: CMATH is a comprehensive library for complex-number arithmetics and mathematics, both in cartesian and polar format (float, double, and extended precision). The implementation in Assembly language ensures superior speed, accuracy, and safety, as compared to other available complex class libraries with their inline or compiled C++ code. All CMATH functions may be called either from C with type-specific function names (e.g., cf_sin, cd_exp, pf_sqrt) or from C++ with overloaded function names (sin, exp, sqrt, etc.). They are optimized for Pentium/PentiumXX, but will run on computers down to 386+387. This version is for Borland C/C++ 4.0 or higher (model DOS-LARGE).

German.Char_Desc_2000: CMATH ist eine umfassende Bibliothek fuer komplexe Mathematik, sowohl in cartesischen als auch in Polar-Koordinaten (float-, double- und extended-genau). Durch die Implementierung in Assembler werden hoechste und compiliertem C/C++-Quellcode weit ueberlegene Geschwindigkeit, Genauigkeit und Sicherheit erreicht.
